title: question: where (if) are the caffe2 libraries?
body_html:
Like many others, I've come from the old caffe2 repository.
I used to use the caffe2 shared libraries directly, I'm not interested in python and I had to built and then manually install the libraries.
Right now using pip3 to install pytorch seems an awful lot easier, but I can't find the libraries anywhere on my system. Are built anywhere, are they installed anywhere or does the default pip process not built them?
I've tried building the caffe2 subfolder directly but run into compilation issues, so I'd rather avoid it if pip3 can pull them.

body:
Like many others, I've come from the old caffe2 repository.
I used to use the caffe2 shared libraries directly, I'm not interested in python and I had to built and then manually install the libraries.
Right now using pip3 to install pytorch seems an awful lot easier, but I can't find the libraries anywhere on my system. Are built anywhere, are they installed anywhere or does the default pip process not built them?
I've tried building the caffe2 subfolder directly but run into compilation issues, so I'd rather avoid it if pip3 can pull them.
